001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.persistence;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.PersistencePort;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessagePair;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
007import java.nio.file.Files;
008import java.nio.file.Path;
009
010/**
011 * Temporary adapter writing message pairs as NDJSON entries. Real SegmentSink wiring will replace this.
012 * <p>Not thread-safe; each instance writes to {@code pairs.ndjson} in the configured directory.
013 *
014 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
015 */
016public final class SegmentSinkAdapter implements PersistencePort {
017  private final Path directory;
018
019  /**
020   * Creates a sink that writes pairs to an NDJSON file.
021   *
022   * @param directory target directory for the NDJSON file
023   * @throws NullPointerException if {@code directory} is {@code null}
024   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
025   */  public SegmentSinkAdapter(Path directory) {
026    this.directory = directory;
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Writes the pair as a single NDJSON line (overwriting the file).
031   *
032   * @param pair pair to serialize; {@code null} is ignored
033   * @throws IOException if the file cannot be written
034   * @implNote Overwrites the file on each call; suitable only for scaffolding.
035   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
036   */  @Override
037  public void persist(MessagePair pair) throws IOException {
038    if (pair == null) return;
039    Files.createDirectories(directory);
040    Path file = directory.resolve("pairs.ndjson");
041    Files.writeString(file, serialize(pair) + "\n", StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
042  }
043
044  private static String serialize(MessagePair pair) {
045    return "{" + "\"protocol\":\"" + pair.request().protocol() + "\"}";
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * No-op close; file IO is performed per write.
050   *
051   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
052   */
053  @Override
054  public void close() throws Exception {}
055}
